name: reorder
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
COMMERCE
  (also re-order) to ask someone to make, supply, or deliver the same goods again: The distributor has re-ordered our products three times in the past two weeks.
to change the way in which something is organized: The country is trying to reorder its public finances. Whole industries and markets are being radically reordered by the electronic revolution. reorder noun [ C ] (also re-order)
COMMERCE The goods are kept at a distribution centre until a reorder comes from a store.
